description: Word 2016 advanced explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using QuickParts, templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to go beyond just text.

episodes.description: Word 2016 advanced explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using QuickParts, templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials series, it can be viewed as a standalone show for users looking to go beyond just text.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.007
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.007 --> 00:00:10.732
Hello everyone, and
welcome to Microsoft Word 2016 Advanced.

3
00:00:10.732 --> 00:00:14.968
My name is Vonne Smith, and I will be
your host for this this course overview.

4
00:00:14.968 --> 00:00:18.140
And what we're going to be covering
in this course overview is, well,

5
00:00:18.140 --> 00:00:21.760
exactly what we're gonna be talking
about throughout these episodes.

6
00:00:21.760 --> 00:00:23.150
Who is this target audience?

7
00:00:23.150 --> 00:00:26.969
Who should be the ones that are watching
these shows in this series?

8
00:00:26.969 --> 00:00:29.666
And do I need to know anything
before we get started?

9
00:00:29.666 --> 00:00:33.870
And any extra tidbits that I might have
for you as we go through everything.

10
00:00:34.920 --> 00:00:38.080
This series is broken up
into two main sections,

11
00:00:38.080 --> 00:00:41.430
we have our graphical elements and
we have automation.

12
00:00:41.430 --> 00:00:43.110
In our graphical elements section,

13
00:00:43.110 --> 00:00:47.690
we're going to be going over how to
insert images in to our Word document.

14
00:00:47.690 --> 00:00:51.210
We'll also be covering shapes and
SmartArt.

15
00:00:51.210 --> 00:00:54.247
We'll also be creating and
inserting tables and charts.

16
00:00:54.247 --> 00:00:58.297
For all of these different graphical
objects, we'll be learning how to format

17
00:00:58.297 --> 00:01:02.662
them, make them really pretty, maybe
throw some pink in there and some purple.

18
00:01:02.662 --> 00:01:05.960
We'll also talk about how
to actually position and

19
00:01:05.960 --> 00:01:08.090
word warp these in our document.

20
00:01:08.090 --> 00:01:12.889
So we know exactly where we want to
have them placed in relationship to

21
00:01:12.889 --> 00:01:14.471
the words on the page.

22
00:01:14.471 --> 00:01:18.149
In the automation section, we're gonna
be talking about creating templates.

23
00:01:18.149 --> 00:01:23.257
And exactly what is a template, which I
feel is a misconstrued word sometimes if

24
00:01:23.257 --> 00:01:28.890
we're talking about the technical, correct
way of using a template within Word.

25
00:01:28.890 --> 00:01:30.410
So definitely stay tuned for

26
00:01:30.410 --> 00:01:35.055
that episode, so we can know that
the right way to be using it.

27
00:01:35.055 --> 00:01:39.310
We're also be talking about adding quick
parts, and how the building blocks within

28
00:01:39.310 --> 00:01:43.462
word can be really hardy to make
us a more efficient user of Word.

29
00:01:43.462 --> 00:01:46.940
We're also gonna be reporting macros,
all those steps that you have to do

30
00:01:46.940 --> 00:01:52.230
all the time, record a macro, hit the play
button and make your life a lot easier.

31
00:01:52.230 --> 00:01:56.660
We'll also be inserting linked objects
in from Excel into our Word documents

32
00:01:56.660 --> 00:02:00.730
to be able to pull that information and
generate the content automatically.

33
00:02:00.730 --> 00:02:05.345
And the all important mail merge,
which is a lot of fun, and once you have

34
00:02:05.345 --> 00:02:09.900
figured out how to do those step by
steps it becomes a lot easier for you.

35
00:02:09.900 --> 00:02:11.230
The target audience,

36
00:02:11.230 --> 00:02:15.390
any Office user would be the perfect
person to watch these episodes.

37
00:02:15.390 --> 00:02:17.050
Now, when I say Office,

38
00:02:17.050 --> 00:02:22.000
notice that here it is capitalized
meaning that Office as Microsoft Office.

39
00:02:22.000 --> 00:02:26.192
You use Word on a daily basis
to create documents for

40
00:02:26.192 --> 00:02:29.712
anything that you use in your office work.

41
00:02:29.712 --> 00:02:34.694
Which might be a home office, could be a
large office, could be a large university,

42
00:02:34.694 --> 00:02:39.070
all the different levels of where
your physical office might be.

43
00:02:39.070 --> 00:02:44.280
But again, in relationship to
the Office products from Microsoft.

44
00:02:44.280 --> 00:02:47.300
And this is for,
I would say, upper basics,

45
00:02:47.300 --> 00:02:51.660
to where you understand how to
insert text into a Word document.

46
00:02:51.660 --> 00:02:54.124
So you're comfortable with inserting text,

47
00:02:54.124 --> 00:02:58.040
you really just wanna kinda fancy up
your documents, and add some of those

48
00:02:58.040 --> 00:03:02.289
different elements that will kind of add
a little bit of flair to your document.

49
00:03:02.289 --> 00:03:06.660
And as well making some of those tasks
that you do to be repeatable, and

50
00:03:06.660 --> 00:03:09.860
make it easier for
you in that automation section.

51
00:03:09.860 --> 00:03:13.380
So this would be more towards,
I would say, your advance users.

52
00:03:13.380 --> 00:03:17.520
This is a continuation from
our Word Essentials series so

53
00:03:17.520 --> 00:03:21.600
I will be referring to that series as
well throughout these different episodes.

54
00:03:21.600 --> 00:03:25.347
So make sure you go check that
out in our course library.

55
00:03:25.347 --> 00:03:27.860
What do you need to know
about before we get started?

56
00:03:27.860 --> 00:03:33.060
A foundational knowledge of Word, such as,
do you know how to format your text?

57
00:03:33.060 --> 00:03:34.371
Are you familiar with styles?

58
00:03:34.371 --> 00:03:37.820
Cuz I love styles, and
I'll be talking about them all the time.

59
00:03:37.820 --> 00:03:41.730
So make sure you have a foundational
knowledge of how to create styles, and

60
00:03:41.730 --> 00:03:43.590
how to use styles effectively.

61
00:03:43.590 --> 00:03:48.370
As well as page layout elements, such
as section breaks, page breaks, how to

62
00:03:48.370 --> 00:03:52.660
create columns, and those are again,
covered in that Word Essential shows.

63
00:03:52.660 --> 00:03:56.450
Basic knowledge of how to use your Windows
operating system, how to go to your

64
00:03:56.450 --> 00:03:59.972
file explorer, how to open files,
how to save files and when to print.

65
00:03:59.972 --> 00:04:00.778
And of course,

66
00:04:00.778 --> 00:04:04.693
some familiarity with other Office
products will be helpful here as well.

67
00:04:04.693 --> 00:04:09.133
If you know how to use Excel pretty well,
then that will help you in Word, or

68
00:04:09.133 --> 00:04:13.592
say you know how to use Outlook or
PowerPoint that could be helpful as well.

69
00:04:13.592 --> 00:04:17.568
There's a lot of things that
crossover between the products, so

70
00:04:17.568 --> 00:04:21.991
if you know a little bit about one,
you know a little bit about the other.

71
00:04:21.991 --> 00:04:26.090
And the last parts I like to talk
about are these extra tidbits.

72
00:04:26.090 --> 00:04:30.070
There's always more than one
way to do something in Word.

73
00:04:30.070 --> 00:04:32.950
So if I might be explaining ways one and
two,

74
00:04:32.950 --> 00:04:38.580
there might be ways three and four, that
you might know about that I didn't cover.

75
00:04:38.580 --> 00:04:41.946
That's just the way it works
within these Office products,

76
00:04:41.946 --> 00:04:43.861
there's always different ways.

77
00:04:43.861 --> 00:04:46.917
And it's one I still learn about it too,
where like, I didn't know you could

78
00:04:46.917 --> 00:04:50.100
right-click and use that option or
I didn't know this shortcut did that.

79
00:04:50.100 --> 00:04:54.920
So just know that there will be
multiple ways that I might not cover.

80
00:04:56.060 --> 00:04:58.280
Updates happen, yes, it does.

81
00:04:58.280 --> 00:05:03.840
So as an Office 365 subscriber,
the product is always updating.

82
00:05:03.840 --> 00:05:08.840
And at the time of the recording,
I am on a specific version of whatever

83
00:05:08.840 --> 00:05:12.960
the update was at in
the Office 365 subscription.

84
00:05:12.960 --> 00:05:16.224
So you might see different buttons or
different options, or

85
00:05:16.224 --> 00:05:19.232
things might have changed
a little bit from the time that

86
00:05:19.232 --> 00:05:22.688
I recorded these episodes to
the time that you're watching it.

87
00:05:22.688 --> 00:05:27.076
And that also being said, the way that
your network is organized, let's say,

88
00:05:27.076 --> 00:05:31.465
if you are in a large organization, you
might not get updates as frequently, or

89
00:05:31.465 --> 00:05:34.440
maybe they've turned them off altogether.

90
00:05:34.440 --> 00:05:39.840
So things might be a little bit different,
so if there's some slight variations or

91
00:05:39.840 --> 00:05:43.260
I'm showing you something that you
see in your documents, it's like,

92
00:05:43.260 --> 00:05:45.020
I don't have this available to me.

93
00:05:45.020 --> 00:05:49.310
That is most of the reasons why it
won't be is cuz of the updates and

94
00:05:49.310 --> 00:05:50.800
what version you're on.

95
00:05:50.800 --> 00:05:55.640
Or your network settings to where
maybe they've put a group policy on to

96
00:05:55.640 --> 00:06:00.100
where you're not allowed to
do this particular function,

97
00:06:00.100 --> 00:06:01.980
because they have locked that down.

98
00:06:01.980 --> 00:06:04.170
So those things happen.

99
00:06:04.170 --> 00:06:07.701
Searching for answers,
the oracle of the Internet is out there.

100
00:06:07.701 --> 00:06:12.134
There's a lot of great information that
you can search through whatever search

101
00:06:12.134 --> 00:06:16.248
engine you feel like to say, hey,
I wanna learn how to do x, y, z in Word.

102
00:06:16.248 --> 00:06:19.670
You will have a ton of different
websites that will be able to guide you

103
00:06:19.670 --> 00:06:23.744
in the right direction, and the Microsoft
help files are always really helpful.

104
00:06:23.744 --> 00:06:26.961
That's probably one of the first
places I would start, and

105
00:06:26.961 --> 00:06:29.000
then go on to other places.

106
00:06:29.000 --> 00:06:31.003
And most importantly, have fun.

107
00:06:31.003 --> 00:06:33.743
I know that this can get
really frustrating sometimes,

108
00:06:33.743 --> 00:06:37.620
especially if you're fighting and
like why won't it just move over?

109
00:06:37.620 --> 00:06:39.550
I've been there, I understand.

110
00:06:39.550 --> 00:06:43.540
But that's where you need to just take a
breath, turn it off, go do something else,

111
00:06:43.540 --> 00:06:46.180
come back and then it's poof,
it magically works.

112
00:06:46.180 --> 00:06:48.460
So just try to keep that attitude of hey,

113
00:06:48.460 --> 00:06:51.340
if I don't get it right the first
time I'll try it again.

114
00:06:51.340 --> 00:06:54.090
Especially when you're watching these
episodes, just have a good time.

115
00:06:54.090 --> 00:06:56.390
We like to cut up here and there and

116
00:06:56.390 --> 00:06:59.140
keep it light, and
just keep it fun for all of you.

117
00:06:59.140 --> 00:07:04.213
So I hope you enjoy, and I hope to
see you soon in some episodes soon.

118
00:07:04.213 --> 00:07:06.141
[LAUGH] Have a good time.

119
00:07:06.141 --> 00:07:11.476
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne introduce the basics concepts of working with images. They differentiate file formats and explain the importance of understanding image resolution and dimensions. Vonne also shows some basic techniques for sizing images in Paint and how to add images to a document in Word.
episodes.title: Images Basics
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.017
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.017 --> 00:00:09.060
Welcome to another great episode
right here on OFFICEPRO.TV.

3
00:00:09.060 --> 00:00:14.460
You're watching the Microsoft Word
2016 advance show.

4
00:00:14.460 --> 00:00:16.150
I'm you're host Ronnie Wong.

5
00:00:16.150 --> 00:00:20.590
And today, we're going to be diving
into well, actually images here, right?

6
00:00:20.590 --> 00:00:22.640
Adding in, doing some basic imaging,

7
00:00:22.640 --> 00:00:26.420
as well as some advanced imaging, and here
to help us out is going to be, of course,

8
00:00:26.420 --> 00:00:29.480
our office pro superstar herself,
Miss Vonne Smith.

9
00:00:29.480 --> 00:00:30.780
Vonne, welcome back to the show.

10
00:00:30.780 --> 00:00:31.640
>> Thank you so much.

11
00:00:31.640 --> 00:00:32.970
So glad to be here.

12
00:00:32.970 --> 00:00:35.340
Ready to talk all about images.

13
00:00:35.340 --> 00:00:36.735
One of my favorite subjects.

14
00:00:36.735 --> 00:00:41.910
It's probably next to topography and Word
and Excel and PowerPoint and Photoshop.

15
00:00:41.910 --> 00:00:44.780
So its there in the gamut.

16
00:00:44.780 --> 00:00:46.580
>> It's kind of kicking down
the line here a little bit.

17
00:00:46.580 --> 00:00:49.820
But no, images are very important for
our docs, aren't they?

18
00:00:49.820 --> 00:00:50.335
>> Yes, they are.

19
00:00:50.335 --> 00:00:53.595
So this is ways that we can
enhance our word files.

20
00:00:53.595 --> 00:00:56.175
Now sometimes yo might not need pictures.

21
00:00:56.175 --> 00:01:00.035
But a lot of times it helps
paint a picture, tell a story.

22
00:01:00.035 --> 00:01:01.695
You know, talking about bunnies?

23
00:01:01.695 --> 00:01:03.665
Why don't you throw a picture
of a bunny in there, right?

24
00:01:03.665 --> 00:01:06.955
If you have a thing about cats,
throw a picture about cats.

25
00:01:06.955 --> 00:01:09.415
So guess what all our images
are going to be about?

26
00:01:09.415 --> 00:01:11.195
>> Bunnies and cats, I'm assuming.

27
00:01:11.195 --> 00:01:12.155
>> You are correct.

28
00:01:12.155 --> 00:01:13.065
>> Well I am a genius.

29
00:01:13.065 --> 00:01:14.340
[LAUGH]
>> So-

30
00:01:14.340 --> 00:01:16.860
>> You are extremely genius, Ronnie.

31
00:01:16.860 --> 00:01:17.925
>> I do know the obvious.

32
00:01:17.925 --> 00:01:19.700
>> [LAUGH]
>> I can do that.

33
00:01:19.700 --> 00:01:21.760
All right, so Vonne,
we start taking a look in,

34
00:01:21.760 --> 00:01:27.750
at the pictures in the basic course, we
probably went over some basic of imaging.

35
00:01:27.750 --> 00:01:29.070
What are we taking a look at here?

36
00:01:29.070 --> 00:01:32.760
>> Actually in the words essential,
we didn't do anything within there.

37
00:01:32.760 --> 00:01:33.760
>> Mostly I'm lying to you.

38
00:01:33.760 --> 00:01:35.440
>> [LAUGH] We were there at the end and
so.

39
00:01:35.440 --> 00:01:36.030
>> Yeah, that’s right.

40
00:01:36.030 --> 00:01:38.970
>> And at the beginning of this is but yes
we're going to start at the beginning and

41
00:01:38.970 --> 00:01:40.560
talk about images.

42
00:01:40.560 --> 00:01:44.540
And this particular episode we're just
going to learn like the file types and

43
00:01:44.540 --> 00:01:49.170
what is that resolution, PPI, because
these are things that, what I love to talk

44
00:01:49.170 --> 00:01:53.160
about and two, it’s just kind of that
base knowledge to have in the background.

45
00:01:53.160 --> 00:01:56.650
While you're not necessarily going
to become a graphic artist or

46
00:01:56.650 --> 00:02:01.530
a graphic designer from just this one
episode and in word as a product,

47
00:02:01.530 --> 00:02:03.700
its a word processing program,

48
00:02:03.700 --> 00:02:08.000
it's not a graphics manipulation
type product, its not Photoshop.

49
00:02:08.000 --> 00:02:11.930
So, it can't do all those things that
those other products can do, but

50
00:02:11.930 --> 00:02:13.420
it actually can do a lot of it.

51
00:02:13.420 --> 00:02:14.260
But having,

52
00:02:14.260 --> 00:02:18.160
at least, a base knowledge of what's
the difference between a JPEG and a GIF?

53
00:02:18.160 --> 00:02:20.810
That can really help you just
find those little things,

54
00:02:20.810 --> 00:02:22.880
is like,
that's why that thing is doing that.

55
00:02:22.880 --> 00:02:24.730
Why do I have a white background?

56
00:02:24.730 --> 00:02:26.870
Okay, now that always
leads to the question of,

57
00:02:26.870 --> 00:02:27.880
well then how can I change it?

58
00:02:27.880 --> 00:02:30.200
Well, there are some things
that we can do in Word, but

59
00:02:30.200 --> 00:02:34.110
it would require you going on to
a different type of product that would be

60
00:02:34.110 --> 00:02:38.240
able to do those types of things,
like Photoshop or even Paint.

61
00:02:38.240 --> 00:02:39.540
>> Paint?
>> Yeah, I'm actually going to

62
00:02:39.540 --> 00:02:41.060
show you a little thing to do-
>> Nice.

63
00:02:41.060 --> 00:02:41.760
>> in Paint today.

64
00:02:41.760 --> 00:02:44.091
Good old Paint in the operating system.

65
00:02:44.091 --> 00:02:44.706
>> [LAUGH]
>> So

66
00:02:44.706 --> 00:02:47.838
I have a PowerPoint presentation
that I have ready on my computer, so

67
00:02:47.838 --> 00:02:50.070
let's go ahead and get into this.

68
00:02:50.070 --> 00:02:52.005
Now I don't really necessarily
need to run the slide show,

69
00:02:52.005 --> 00:02:54.820
because I've got most of
the information on here.

70
00:02:54.820 --> 00:02:58.150
And so I took this actually
from my PowerPoint show,

71
00:02:58.150 --> 00:03:01.258
modified it a little bit to just
kind of cover all the basics.

72
00:03:01.258 --> 00:03:07.290
So file yypes, we talk about file, I love
to talk about file types but we kind of,

73
00:03:07.290 --> 00:03:10.620
I don't want to say take it for granted
but its just like, there is a picture,

74
00:03:10.620 --> 00:03:14.850
take a picture with my camera or phone and
then I have it and then I send it to

75
00:03:14.850 --> 00:03:18.960
people, and I share it and I get pictures,
and you think a picture's a picture.

76
00:03:20.030 --> 00:03:24.660
Kind of, but we've always been
talking about languages right?

77
00:03:25.920 --> 00:03:31.810
Word talks in Word, Excel talks in Excel,
file types and whether it's ,docx or .doc.

78
00:03:31.810 --> 00:03:34.240
What does that mean?

79
00:03:34.240 --> 00:03:35.440
Images are the same way,

80
00:03:35.440 --> 00:03:39.800
and when you're talking about pictures,
you're talking about raster information.

81
00:03:39.800 --> 00:03:42.550
All of photographs are made up of pixels.

82
00:03:42.550 --> 00:03:44.590
>> Right.
>> So pixels that are in some sort of

83
00:03:44.590 --> 00:03:48.280
grid formation that goes ahead and
makes all of the colors and

84
00:03:48.280 --> 00:03:50.202
the things that we see on our screen.

85
00:03:50.202 --> 00:03:54.100
Well of the different types that we have,
JPEG

86
00:03:54.100 --> 00:03:58.660
probably would be the most common file
type that most people are familiar with,

87
00:03:58.660 --> 00:04:02.800
because it's the most common for
just regular photographs.

88
00:04:02.800 --> 00:04:06.150
Because it's that pixel
information that's in there and

89
00:04:06.150 --> 00:04:10.030
it has a lot of color support in
that particular file format and

90
00:04:10.030 --> 00:04:15.800
the other thing that I don't have on this
slide, is that it uses compression to

91
00:04:15.800 --> 00:04:20.970
store the file, so it doesn't take
as much room on our computer.

92
00:04:20.970 --> 00:04:23.730
That's the other thing we will talk
about as long with file types talk about

93
00:04:23.730 --> 00:04:28.220
resolution and overall document
dimensions or image dimensions.

94
00:04:28.220 --> 00:04:30.240
That makes a huge deal.

95
00:04:30.240 --> 00:04:35.300
So, our photos, and our pictures that we
take with our cameras, normally takes them

96
00:04:35.300 --> 00:04:40.750
at a higher resolution, to be able to
transport it, and do whatever you want.

00:11:06.860 --> 00:11:08.930
>> It does, the higher the resolution,

>> Yeah, especially with nowadays,
all of our HDTVs and

00:11:12.369 --> 00:11:14.462
if you have a higher resolution,

00:11:14.462 --> 00:11:19.653
that's what I always equate it to cuz they

00:11:19.653 --> 00:11:23.110
And when you're buying those types

00:11:23.110 --> 00:11:24.515
So yes, the bigger the better.

00:11:24.515 --> 00:11:30.152
And that is normally true if we're

00:11:30.152 --> 00:11:32.140

But when we're talking about images,

It technically means pixels per inch.

The other thing to think about,

00:11:49.662 --> 00:11:51.236
we're usually talking about paper.

00:11:51.236 --> 00:11:53.835
>> Paper.
>> We're not talking about screens

00:11:53.835 --> 00:11:54.890
necessarily.

00:11:54.890 --> 00:11:59.532
So that's where you get this

00:11:59.532 --> 00:12:01.528

And, have you ever encountered

00:12:20.439 --> 00:12:22.768

00:12:22.768 --> 00:12:25.200
It's not always about resolution, okay.

00:12:25.200 --> 00:12:27.620
It's really more about
the pixel dimensions.

00:12:27.620 --> 00:12:30.450
And that's why I have

00:12:30.450 --> 00:12:33.861
While they work together,
because how many,

00:12:33.861 --> 00:12:37.888
if I have a file that is
600 pixels by 400 pixels.

00:12:37.888 --> 00:12:42.930
Because photographs are in pixels,
that's what they live in.

250
00:12:42.930 --> 00:12:50.776
But the resolution, I could have a 600 by
400 image that is a 300 ppi or a 72 ppi.

251
00:12:50.776 --> 00:12:54.028
But they're still 600 by 400 pixels.

252
00:12:54.028 --> 00:12:57.076
The amount of pixels hasn't changed.

00:12:57.076 --> 00:13:00.964
It really just depends on what
device that I'm going to be making

00:13:00.964 --> 00:13:02.680

00:13:02.680 --> 00:13:05.022
Where is it's final space?

And this is something like in

00:13:07.940 --> 00:13:11.471
And when I talk about print in this way,

00:13:11.471 --> 00:13:14.900

00:13:14.900 --> 00:13:15.735

So they usually tell you,

00:13:20.930 --> 00:13:24.920

00:13:24.920 --> 00:13:29.050
All of your graphics need to be

00:13:29.050 --> 00:13:34.835
So that way, and if you think about it, if

00:13:34.835 --> 00:13:40.395
you to be able to have a larger image on a
piece of paper to be 5 inches by 4 inches.

00:13:40.395 --> 00:13:45.936

00:13:45.936 --> 00:13:49.258
And so that's where all of
your cameras and phones,

00:13:49.258 --> 00:13:52.460
it takes it at a much

00:13:52.460 --> 00:13:55.090
So that way,
when you make the resolution bigger,

00:13:55.090 --> 00:14:00.600
then the overall document size in its

00:14:00.600 --> 00:14:02.710
The total number of pixels stay the same,

00:14:02.710 --> 00:14:05.720
it's just that everything

272
00:14:05.720 --> 00:14:08.820
So that's where you get the whole
idea of having resolution.

273
00:14:08.820 --> 00:14:10.920
And this is where somebody, or

It also really is do you have

00:14:21.758 --> 00:14:22.319

00:14:22.319 --> 00:14:23.480

00:14:23.480 --> 00:14:25.560
And the idea with our computers,

00:14:25.560 --> 00:14:29.100
not all the programs are good

00:14:29.100 --> 00:14:30.953
So it just kinda guesses, and so

00:14:40.313 --> 00:14:41.960
Cuz it just didn't have

00:14:41.960 --> 00:14:47.109
So it's better to go smaller and
remove information than it is to try to

287
00:14:47.109 --> 00:14:52.279
be smaller and go bigger and
create information that doesn't exist.

00:14:52.279 --> 00:14:57.871

And now I have a cross here to where I
am going to say this is the space that I

551
00:28:53.282 --> 00:28:54.170
want to get.

552
00:28:54.170 --> 00:28:58.400
Because maybe I wanted to show somebody
about the Quick Access toolbar up here.

553
00:28:58.400 --> 00:29:00.290
And then I had a collapse ribbon.

554
00:29:00.290 --> 00:29:03.690
If I click hold and drag, let go.

555
00:29:03.690 --> 00:29:09.350
As soon as I let go, that becomes
the screen clipping that I want to access.

556
00:29:09.350 --> 00:29:10.820
And look at that.

557
00:29:10.820 --> 00:29:12.320
I guess Word has decided like,

558
00:29:12.320 --> 00:29:15.950
nope, you're not supposed
to be doing this right now.

559
00:29:15.950 --> 00:29:17.940
But it is nice-
>> Auto recovered though.

560
00:29:17.940 --> 00:29:20.480
>> Auto recovery is
a beautiful thing [LAUGH].

561
00:29:20.480 --> 00:29:25.340
So [SOUND] at least we know that
auto recovery is working smoothly.

562
00:29:25.340 --> 00:29:26.330
And then that's where we go.

563
00:29:26.330 --> 00:29:29.530
But that's how you do screen
clippings which will be really cool.

564
00:29:29.530 --> 00:29:32.620
I know you're giving me the, hey, we're
getting towards the end there Ronnie.

565
00:29:32.620 --> 00:29:34.580
But I have one last thing
I want to show you.

566
00:29:34.580 --> 00:29:35.380
>> Sure.

567
00:29:35.380 --> 00:29:40.750
>> It kind of goes along with that screen
clipping within your Office product.

568
00:29:40.750 --> 00:29:45.350
But it's actually a tool outside,
it's in Windows.

569
00:29:45.350 --> 00:29:46.870
I love this tool, Ronnie.

570
00:29:46.870 --> 00:29:47.920
The Snipping Tool.

571
00:29:47.920 --> 00:29:48.640
>> Yeah.

572
00:29:48.640 --> 00:29:51.060
>> Now, the Snipping Tool is pretty great.

573
00:29:51.060 --> 00:29:54.430
I'm just going into the search and
typing in Snipping Tool.

574
00:29:54.430 --> 00:29:59.410
It, well, takes snippings of your
computer [LAUGH] who wherever you want.

575
00:29:59.410 --> 00:30:04.650
So if I was trying to, I'm gonna go ahead
and minimize Word, minimize PowerPoint.

576
00:30:04.650 --> 00:30:08.300
Because maybe I'd like to
take a screenshot here.

577
00:30:08.300 --> 00:30:13.600
I can come over to my Snipping Tool, get
what I want on the screen up, ready to go.

578
00:30:13.600 --> 00:30:14.970
And then click the New button.

579
00:30:14.970 --> 00:30:17.840
I will say there's this delay because
a lot times I'm trying to show drop

580
00:30:17.840 --> 00:30:20.270
down menus, and
I have to like really quickly go for it.

581
00:30:20.270 --> 00:30:24.680
This is a newer thing, so if I have it
delay like two seconds, I can get to

582
00:30:25.900 --> 00:30:28.919
activating the drop down to show
the option that I want people to click.

583
00:30:30.160 --> 00:30:33.020
It's really like changed my
world [LAUGH] just to know.

584
00:30:33.020 --> 00:30:35.520
I was like, my God, that's amazing.

585
00:30:35.520 --> 00:30:41.070
Let's go into New,
it dims down my screen, I get my cursor.

586
00:30:41.070 --> 00:30:45.652
I say let's go ahead and
make this my snipping, let go,

587
00:30:45.652 --> 00:30:48.590
puts it into the snipping program.

588
00:30:49.660 --> 00:30:51.390
That is like,
well that's just really the same thing,

589
00:30:51.390 --> 00:30:53.810
as the insert the screen
clipping that you went into Word.

590
00:30:53.810 --> 00:30:55.440
Why am I making this extra step?

591
00:30:55.440 --> 00:30:57.160
If I just wanted to go
right into my document?

592
00:30:57.160 --> 00:30:59.570
The thing is that in the Snipping Tool,

593
00:30:59.570 --> 00:31:03.005
you have some really simple
ways to mark up an image.

594
00:31:03.005 --> 00:31:06.525
So a lot of times,
I'm trying to draw attention to,

595
00:31:06.525 --> 00:31:11.009
this is the choice that you want
to choose, like I wanna circle it.

596
00:31:11.009 --> 00:31:15.320
Well if I do it here in the Snipping Tool,
I can mark it up because I have the pen.

597
00:31:15.320 --> 00:31:21.680
And I can say like this one right here and
I can do little arrows.

598
00:31:21.680 --> 00:31:23.850
And I can say hi there's a smiley face.

599
00:31:23.850 --> 00:31:26.130
And I can change to different colors.

600
00:31:26.130 --> 00:31:30.570
I can do the highlighters cuz maybe
I want to highlight the word bird.

601
00:31:30.570 --> 00:31:33.930
So I can mark up, very simple
markups within this photograph,

602
00:31:33.930 --> 00:31:35.650
yeah, this photograph.

603
00:31:35.650 --> 00:31:39.040
I don't even have to save it on
my computer if I don't want to.

604
00:31:39.040 --> 00:31:41.330
Now you could and save it as a file.

605
00:31:41.330 --> 00:31:48.535
If you just copy, edit, copy or Ctrl + C,
come over to Word Come back over here.

606
00:31:48.535 --> 00:31:50.340
Let's hit Enter,
I'll just hit Enter twice.

607
00:31:50.340 --> 00:31:51.410
And then just paste, Ctrl+V.

608
00:31:51.410 --> 00:31:54.230
Then you got the picture right in there.

609
00:31:54.230 --> 00:31:56.760
So it's the screen clipping but

610
00:31:56.760 --> 00:32:01.360
going outside of it instead of
staying inside of the Word.

611
00:32:01.360 --> 00:32:06.850
You go and you can do stuff like this and
the mark up is part of the picture.

612
00:32:06.850 --> 00:32:10.370
I would always go back and
I'd try to make circles and put it on top,

613
00:32:10.370 --> 00:32:12.070
cuz we're gonna add shapes
to all these documents.

614
00:32:12.070 --> 00:32:14.880
But then if you move things around,
then the shape doesn't stay with it.

615
00:32:14.880 --> 00:32:16.220
I tried grouping, but this is just so

616
00:32:16.220 --> 00:32:18.370
much easier if I just wanna
do a quick little markup.

617
00:32:18.370 --> 00:32:21.700
So copying and
pasting from your Snipping Tool

618
00:32:21.700 --> 00:32:26.200
to bring out part of the different things
on your screen is super, super handy.

619
00:32:26.200 --> 00:32:31.230
So those are the three ways
that I can get photographs or

620
00:32:31.230 --> 00:32:34.620
images into my Word document.

621
00:32:34.620 --> 00:32:37.060
So, that will be the end of this episode.

622
00:32:37.060 --> 00:32:40.990
And we'll move on to formatting
our pictures in the next one,

623
00:32:40.990 --> 00:32:42.840
so check that one out.

624
00:32:42.840 --> 00:32:44.460
>> All right Vonne,
well that sounds great.

625
00:32:44.460 --> 00:32:45.490
Thank you again for

626
00:32:45.490 --> 00:32:50.480
at least helping us get the mechanics
down of how we can get images into Word.

627
00:32:50.480 --> 00:32:53.900
Also, we took a brief look at some of
the history behind some of the formats

628
00:32:53.900 --> 00:32:54.840
as well.

629
00:32:54.840 --> 00:32:58.110
And then, of course, we just talked
about what was the nature of cats and

630
00:32:58.110 --> 00:33:00.240
bunnies here, I mean,
who would have known.

631
00:33:00.240 --> 00:33:03.480
But that is a great place for
us to go ahead and end this episode then.

632
00:33:03.480 --> 00:33:06.650
For OfficeProTV,
I'm your host Ronnie Wong.

633
00:33:06.650 --> 00:33:07.650
>> And I'm Vonne Smith.

634
00:33:07.650 --> 00:33:12.596
>> Stay tuned right here for
more Microsoft Word 2016 advanced shows.

635
00:33:12.596 --> 00:33:18.375
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne demonstrate how to format images in Word. Vonne shows how to properly size images, add word wrap for moving image, crop, and apply preset styles. She also reviews other image adjustments such as brightness and contrast, color correction, and artistic effects. Lastly, she explains when and why you would compress, change, and reset images.
episodes.title: Images: Format
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

All right, so Vonne, here it is.

We know a little bit more about images and

22

Now we're going into formatting images.

23
00:00:59.690 --> 00:01:03.499
Hopefully, this is to help us to make
better use of the images within our

24
00:01:03.499 --> 00:01:04.203
documents.

25
00:01:04.203 --> 00:01:05.230
Is that what we're doing?

26
00:01:05.230 --> 00:01:07.928
>> Exactly,
this is where we put the image in.

27
00:01:07.928 --> 00:01:13.868
We just did insert picture or is it insert
in online picture or the screenshot.

28
00:01:13.868 --> 00:01:16.730
But now,
what about making it black and white?

29
00:01:16.730 --> 00:01:18.010
What about putting a border on it?

30

What about moving it around in a document?

31

So that's why I titled this Images Format.

32

33
00:01:27.180 --> 00:01:32.131
And actually a lot of the image

34

in Word and all of Office have,
it's so grown up now.

35
00:01:36.272 --> 00:01:40.422
They've really advanced from what you
used to be able to do back in the day

36
00:01:40.422 --> 00:01:41.110

37
00:01:41.110 --> 00:01:45.946
And so you can create some really
cool looking graphics without knowing

38

39
00:01:51.115 --> 00:01:54.150
You could do it all within Office,

So, all the same things that

And PowerPoint might have a few extras.

I wouldn't say necessarily more

bit more of a graphical program,
because you're putting images and

45

things on to a slide, you might have
a little bit more freedom, I would say.

46
00:02:19.552 --> 00:02:23.960
Like you can move it anywhere around
because it's like a blank canvas per se.

47
00:02:23.960 --> 00:02:26.790
In Word, it's not a canvas.

48
00:02:26.790 --> 00:02:35.160
So moving it around, you gotta get it into
a mode that would let you move it around.

49
00:02:35.160 --> 00:02:38.600
But then understanding what's
happening when you move it around,

50
00:02:38.600 --> 00:02:43.510
it's important to just be
aware of what it's doing.

51
00:02:43.510 --> 00:02:46.170
It does have slight limitations on there.

52
00:02:46.170 --> 00:02:47.150
So let's jump back in.

53
00:02:47.150 --> 00:02:48.610
We have a file.

54
00:02:48.610 --> 00:02:51.625
Now I have this called inserted images.

00:02:51.625 --> 00:02:56.431
This is actually like, right where we had

00:02:56.431 --> 00:02:59.109
I had to restart the computer and

00:03:02.008 --> 00:03:04.611
[LAUGH] So
we did a little technical help to it, and

59
00:03:04.611 --> 00:03:07.860
I just wanted to make sure that I

60
00:03:07.860 --> 00:03:12.593
So this is not part of the exercise files
that are associated with the images, so if

61
00:03:12.593 --> 00:03:17.689

62
00:03:17.689 --> 00:03:23.171
And we had put in pictures of fish up and

00:03:23.171 --> 00:03:26.891

64
00:03:26.891 --> 00:03:31.180
Now what about changing the size,
moving it around?

65
00:03:31.180 --> 00:03:35.456
Let's start with the size first, and
really more about the mouse cursor icons.

66
00:03:35.456 --> 00:03:40.505
Because when you're over items or
objects in Word,

67
00:03:40.505 --> 00:03:43.190
you're normally gonna get what
you can see it, there we go.

68
00:03:43.190 --> 00:03:46.050
You can see that this is
a four pointed arrow and

69
00:03:46.050 --> 00:03:47.510
it has a little white arrow on top of it.

70
00:03:47.510 --> 00:03:50.311
That means that your over
something that can be selected.

71
00:03:50.311 --> 00:03:54.999
So if you single click on it, then it
brings up the little dots around the edge

72
00:03:54.999 --> 00:04:00.130

this little handle thing at the top.

73
00:04:00.130 --> 00:04:03.694
So these are all the different things that

74
00:04:03.694 --> 00:04:08.950
And when you come to any of those dots
you get the two pointed white arrow.

75
00:04:08.950 --> 00:04:11.489
Two pointed white arrows mean
that you can change the size.

76
00:04:12.640 --> 00:04:15.290
Now one thing I would
probably suggest not doing

77
00:04:15.290 --> 00:04:20.162
would be taking it from either the top or
the bottom in the middle and doing this.

78
00:04:20.162 --> 00:04:20.662
>> Uh-huh.

79
00:04:20.662 --> 00:04:22.977
>> You don't want to squash your images,

80
00:04:22.977 --> 00:04:25.793
you wanna keep the aspect
ratio proportional.

81
00:04:25.793 --> 00:04:30.041
Or at least for me I would, and
this is one of my pet peeves for images,

82
00:04:30.041 --> 00:04:35.180
you start seeing them squashed, and
I'm like, no, just go from the corner.

83
00:04:35.180 --> 00:04:36.199
Go from the corner!

84
00:04:36.199 --> 00:04:40.663
Cuz if you go from the corner and you drag
in, and I'm not holding shift by the way,

85
00:04:40.663 --> 00:04:44.939
this is just a thing that happens in your
Office products and specifically Word

86
00:04:44.939 --> 00:04:49.760
here, is that if you go from a corner it's
gonna keep that aspect ratio proportion.

87
00:04:49.760 --> 00:04:51.171
That's good, so always do that.

88
00:04:51.171 --> 00:04:54.679
It doesn't matter if you go from
the top corner or the bottom,

89
00:04:54.679 --> 00:04:59.268
the only thing is that when you go from
the top, you think it's gonna go this way,

90
00:04:59.268 --> 00:05:03.520
like down, but the way that this
photograph is placed into this document,

91
00:05:03.520 --> 00:05:06.250
it just stays right where

92
00:05:06.250 --> 00:05:10.681
We'll cover that in just a little bit.

93
00:05:10.681 --> 00:05:14.417
The handle on the top,
this is your rotate handle.

94
00:05:14.417 --> 00:05:17.890
And you get this little swirly arrow for
your mouse cursor.

95
00:05:17.890 --> 00:05:19.930
That means if I click,
hold and drag, you're like,

96
00:05:19.930 --> 00:05:24.170
whoa why is it, it seems like it's
kinda rotating in a weird space.

97
00:05:24.170 --> 00:05:26.810
Again, this is because of the text wrap or

98
00:05:26.810 --> 00:05:31.220
the positioning options
that are on by default for

99
00:05:31.220 --> 00:05:37.230
this graphic, but at least you know
that that's what that icon will do.

100
00:05:37.230 --> 00:05:41.208
And right now I'm doing everything
within just a blank document,

101
00:05:41.208 --> 00:05:44.844
just to kinda get us familiar
with all of these things first.

102
00:05:44.844 --> 00:05:49.333
Now, the moving around your photograph,
okay?

103
00:05:49.333 --> 00:05:52.359
And as soon as I said it,
I'm gonna kinda jump over here to,

104
00:05:52.359 --> 00:05:54.253
let's get it into some text, okay?

105
00:05:54.253 --> 00:05:59.063
I'm gonna put my cursor here,
let's insert a picture, and let's insert,

106
00:05:59.063 --> 00:06:03.400
we'll go ahead and insert Mr.
Fuego and he's kind of big.

107
00:06:03.400 --> 00:06:07.275
We already know how to resize it, so
I'll grab a corner, size it down.

108
00:06:07.275 --> 00:06:10.170
There's that alt text that's
coming up right there.

109
00:06:11.250 --> 00:06:14.776
And that's something that is
a new thing within my most

110
00:06:14.776 --> 00:06:19.003
recent update of Office products
that just happened last night.

111
00:06:19.003 --> 00:06:22.929
Well, at the time of this recording,
[LAUGH] it was just last night.

112
00:06:22.929 --> 00:06:24.251
So if you're not seeing,

113
00:06:24.251 --> 00:06:28.350
that you might not have the most recent
build of this particular product.

114
00:06:28.350 --> 00:06:34.291
Super quick, if I come over here to file
account see this is what build I'm on,

115
00:06:34.291 --> 00:06:36.103
I'm on 8201.2.

116
00:06:36.103 --> 00:06:39.048
So if yours is lower than that
in the number, in your account,

117
00:06:39.048 --> 00:06:43.030
then that's why yours doesn't
show the same way that mine does.

118
00:06:43.030 --> 00:06:46.770
So I've made it a little bit smaller, but
notice how when I put the picture in,

119
00:06:46.770 --> 00:06:51.920
when I insert a photograph,
it is in line with text.

120
00:06:51.920 --> 00:06:54.260
That's what it does by default.

121
00:06:54.260 --> 00:06:55.490
This little guy right next,

122
00:06:55.490 --> 00:06:59.860
it's a little rainbow looking thing, this
is where you have your layout options.

123
00:06:59.860 --> 00:07:01.830
The other thing that I
haven't pointed out yet

124
00:07:01.830 --> 00:07:06.630
is that you also have this
particular option on the Format tab,

125
00:07:06.630 --> 00:07:11.160
the contextual tab that's going to
come up when you put in images.

126
00:07:11.160 --> 00:07:14.422
If I click off of this,
that tab goes away.

127
00:07:14.422 --> 00:07:19.024
So contextual tabs are things that
happen when you're on something that is

128
00:07:19.024 --> 00:07:25.090
selected that brings up other options that
aren't normally shown on your ribbon.

129
00:07:25.090 --> 00:07:27.742
So select to effect,
get our picture selected, and

130
00:07:27.742 --> 00:07:31.710
now I have the same thing right here
with it, it's known as text wrap.

131
00:07:31.710 --> 00:07:35.950
How does the text wrap around this image?

132
00:07:35.950 --> 00:07:40.840
And then the other one that kind of goes
hand-in-hand with it is the position.

133
00:07:40.840 --> 00:07:45.020
The position, as you can see,
it is in line with text.

134
00:07:45.020 --> 00:07:48.730
So it stays as, almost like
a character if you typed in a letter.

135
00:07:48.730 --> 00:07:52.198
That's where it's in line with it,
as opposed to some of the other ones.

this is one of those things where you

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne continue the demonstration of formatting image in Word. They discuss how to add alternative text to an image so it can be useful integrating with software designed for visually impaired individuals. Vonne shows us to use intelligent services as well as adding descriptions to images in the format pane.
episodes.title: Images: Format Part 2

And that was because us as coders,

00:22:07.200 --> 00:22:09.107
So it's all kind of-
>> Building their database, and

426
00:22:09.107 --> 00:22:12.020
I know that's one of the things that
the developer was actually speaking on.

427
00:22:12.020 --> 00:22:14.180
Is that they were limited,

428
00:22:14.180 --> 00:22:17.150
I don't remember the actual number
at the time of that recording.

429
00:22:17.150 --> 00:22:20.530
But they were limited to the type of
images that were already in the database

430
00:22:20.530 --> 00:22:21.430
and looking to grow it.

431
00:22:21.430 --> 00:22:24.130
So hey, if we can help out
then I'm all about that.

432
00:22:24.130 --> 00:22:26.497
>> Right, yeah,
>> As long as it's being used for good.

433
00:22:26.497 --> 00:22:28.005
>> [LAUGH]
>> And not like some nefarious purpose

434
00:22:28.005 --> 00:22:28.908
over here I don't know.

435
00:22:28.908 --> 00:22:29.726
[LAUGH].

436
00:22:29.726 --> 00:22:30.661
>> Yeah and I think that's where

437
00:22:30.661 --> 00:22:31.949
the creepy element comes in,
>> Exactly.

438
00:22:31.949 --> 00:22:35.118
>> It's like, how did you know
that that was a cat in a costume?

439
00:22:35.118 --> 00:22:36.091
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] You know?

440
00:22:36.091 --> 00:22:37.170
Like, how did you know that?

441
00:22:37.170 --> 00:22:39.490
Well, okay, you got the cattle, I see.

442
00:22:39.490 --> 00:22:41.940
But, it's working on it.

443
00:22:41.940 --> 00:22:44.573
If we put in a whole bunch more
pictures of antelope up there,

444
00:22:44.573 --> 00:22:47.211
they'll probably realize-
>> They'll be able to distinguish

445
00:22:47.211 --> 00:22:49.040
the actual figure and everything.

446
00:22:49.040 --> 00:22:51.460
>> Yeah, it'll see like the stride,
and see like the little horns,

447
00:22:51.460 --> 00:22:53.980
like that's not a cow, that's an antelope.

448
00:22:53.980 --> 00:22:57.869
So building that whole feature up and
I thought that was pretty cool.

449
00:22:57.869 --> 00:23:02.335
The last thing I wanted to leave us
on was that this was a document I

450
00:23:02.335 --> 00:23:06.083
started from scratch and
it has all the new services.

451
00:23:06.083 --> 00:23:10.830
I also have a PowerPoint that I created
and we used in our last episode.

452
00:23:10.830 --> 00:23:14.220
We were talking about images or
maybe two episodes.

453
00:23:14.220 --> 00:23:17.038
It's okay, maybe you're not
watching this in succession.

454
00:23:17.038 --> 00:23:18.950
It's something about images,
I think it was the introduction one.

455
00:23:20.040 --> 00:23:24.410
So you can see here,
I have the same picture of Bishop.

456
00:23:24.410 --> 00:23:28.720
But notice that if I edit the alternate
text, it doesn't have anything in here.

457
00:23:28.720 --> 00:23:31.651
Because this was created before my update.

458
00:23:31.651 --> 00:23:32.835
So it wasn't doing the automatic match.

459
00:23:32.835 --> 00:23:35.314
>> So this is like,
fresh, hot off the press,

460
00:23:35.314 --> 00:23:38.276
like the newest option
here that you're covering.

461
00:23:38.276 --> 00:23:38.983
That's pretty cool, Vonne.

462
00:23:38.983 --> 00:23:40.789
[LAUGH]
>> Yeah, yeah, at the time of recording.

463
00:23:40.789 --> 00:23:42.665
[LAUGH]
>> At the time of recording, yes,

464
00:23:42.665 --> 00:23:44.630
we always need to throw that in there too.

465
00:23:44.630 --> 00:23:47.620
>> Yeah, this was done before that update.

466
00:23:47.620 --> 00:23:49.040
So you can see it doesn't have anything.

467
00:23:49.040 --> 00:23:51.910
But the cool thing is, look,
generate a description for me.

468
00:23:53.032 --> 00:23:58.033
So if I click on this,
it will go through a close-up of a cat.

469
00:23:58.033 --> 00:23:59.910
All right, so it's fine in that.

470
00:23:59.910 --> 00:24:01.370
Let's go ahead and see what this one does.

471
00:24:01.370 --> 00:24:04.040
I think this one still does,
yeah, a cat wearing a costume.

472
00:24:04.040 --> 00:24:09.170
But you can see that if I had a file that
was already made, and I wanted to do that.

473
00:24:09.170 --> 00:24:12.657
Right-click, go to Edit alternate text,
and

474
00:24:12.657 --> 00:24:17.811
then you can go ahead and have it
generate its own description for you.

475
00:24:17.811 --> 00:24:21.470
Maybe it'll get it right, maybe it won't,
that's okay, we can always edit it.

476
00:24:21.470 --> 00:24:24.970
And we do know if any of those services
that we don't have any of this stuff,

477
00:24:24.970 --> 00:24:26.490
you can always go back.

478
00:24:26.490 --> 00:24:29.514
And add the alternate text from
the right-click format and

479
00:24:29.514 --> 00:24:32.270
then going into the alt-text place.

480
00:24:32.270 --> 00:24:36.710
>> All right, so I think that about rounds
out our concepts here for this show.

481
00:24:36.710 --> 00:24:39.370
But stay tuned we have
a lot more headed your way.

482
00:24:39.370 --> 00:24:41.530
Remember, I've been your host,
Cherokee Boose.

483
00:24:41.530 --> 00:24:42.340
>> And I'm Vonne Smith.

484
00:24:42.340 --> 00:24:45.037
>> See you next time here at OfficeProTV

485
00:24:45.037 --> 00:24:50.060
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne add shapes into documents to enhance the appearance and emphasize text. Vonne shows how to add shapes and then format shapes by resizing, rotating, and changing the color of the fill and outline. She also shows how to add and format text to a shape, format shapes with the format pane, and edit individual points to create custom shape.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:05.955 --> 00:00:08.880
Welcome to another great episode
right here on OfficePro TV.

2
00:00:08.880 --> 00:00:13.730
You're watching the Microsoft Word
2016 Advanced show.

3
00:00:13.730 --> 00:00:18.325
I'm your host Ronnie Wong, and today we're
gonna be taking a look at adding and

4
00:00:18.325 --> 00:00:19.572
formatting shapes.

5
00:00:19.572 --> 00:00:23.150
And here to help us do that in
Microsoft Word is gonna of course be

6
00:00:23.150 --> 00:00:26.406
the Microsoft Word Maestra herself,
Miss Vonne Smith.

7
00:00:26.406 --> 00:00:27.680
Vonne, welcome back to the show.

8
00:00:27.680 --> 00:00:31.250
>> That was a lot of Ms. [LAUGH]
>> It was and you know it's strange.

9
00:00:31.250 --> 00:00:32.333
There's actually two forms of that.

10
00:00:32.333 --> 00:00:33.168
There's maestro but

11
00:00:33.168 --> 00:00:36.142
apparently that's the masculine and
there's maestra which is feminine.

12
00:00:36.142 --> 00:00:37.085
>> I like that.

13
00:00:37.085 --> 00:00:41.887
>> So Vonne, welcome to the show as we
begin, as we start to take a look here.

14
00:00:41.887 --> 00:00:44.870
We've already added in some, pictures.

15
00:00:44.870 --> 00:00:46.750
What makes this different?

16
00:00:46.750 --> 00:00:47.840
>> Well, we're adding in shapes.

17
00:00:47.840 --> 00:00:49.670
We're gonna shape it up a little bit.

18
00:00:49.670 --> 00:00:53.830
And while it is a graphical element, just
like as we have with our photographs and

19
00:00:53.830 --> 00:00:58.240
our pictures, and whether we get it from
online or from our computers, shapes are,

20
00:00:58.240 --> 00:01:01.900
well, what you think of as shapes,
circles, squares,

21
00:01:01.900 --> 00:01:04.350
hearts, some lightning bolts.

22
00:01:04.350 --> 00:01:08.969
Different shapes that are already
predetermined for us that we pick,

23
00:01:08.969 --> 00:01:12.350
and then we draw into our Word document.

24
00:01:12.350 --> 00:01:14.910
So we just have ones that we wanna do.

25
00:01:14.910 --> 00:01:18.670
>> All right, so Vonne, everybody loves
to add in a good heart shape right in

26
00:01:18.670 --> 00:01:19.960
the middle of that business letter.

27
00:01:19.960 --> 00:01:21.860
So, how are we going to do this?

28
00:01:21.860 --> 00:01:22.630
>> Exactly, yes.

29
00:01:22.630 --> 00:01:25.890
[LAUGH] You definitely want to put hearts,
and rainbows, and stars, and

30
00:01:25.890 --> 00:01:29.050
smiley faces all over
your business documents.

31
00:01:29.050 --> 00:01:31.450
But Word has different meanings for
different people.

32
00:01:31.450 --> 00:01:33.449
Maybe you're a school teacher, and

33
00:01:33.449 --> 00:01:36.490
then you wanna jazz up your
documents a little bit.

34
00:01:36.490 --> 00:01:38.430
So you can go ahead and add some shapes.

35
00:01:38.430 --> 00:01:40.610
So we're going to go
through in this episode,

36
00:01:40.610 --> 00:01:42.940
just adding them in to our documents.

37
00:01:42.940 --> 00:01:46.130
Understanding what we need
to do to move them around or

38
00:01:46.130 --> 00:01:48.920
how we can format them into position.

39
00:01:48.920 --> 00:01:50.980
Just like when we were
talking about our images,

40
00:01:50.980 --> 00:01:54.550
we're talked a lot about word wrap and
the positioning on the page.

41
00:01:54.550 --> 00:01:58.340
So we're going to address that with shapes
and how they're a little bit different

42
00:01:58.340 --> 00:02:01.670
than images, but we can end up
getting them to the right place.

43
00:02:01.670 --> 00:02:04.890
And then changing colors and
adding some text.

44
00:02:04.890 --> 00:02:08.130
And so that's gonna be what we're
gonna work on in this episode.

45
00:02:08.130 --> 00:02:12.370
So let's hop on down in here, and I have
a blank document for us to just kinda

46
00:02:12.370 --> 00:02:17.130
play around with to get familiar with,
just using shapes, in general.

47
00:02:17.130 --> 00:02:20.820
Then I also have a file that we've been
using throughout this whole series,

48
00:02:20.820 --> 00:02:22.760
really, it's just Add Graphics.

49
00:02:22.760 --> 00:02:26.090
It's just text on it, so
how does the graphics

50
00:02:26.090 --> 00:02:30.545
work within a Word document that
usually will have, hm, well, text.

51
00:02:30.545 --> 00:02:32.110
>> Mm-hm.

52
00:02:32.110 --> 00:02:35.100
>> So,
let's go back over to the blank document.

53
00:02:36.450 --> 00:02:40.100
And we're gonna go to insert,
let's start there, and insert shapes.

54
00:02:40.100 --> 00:02:45.520
Now, the way I describe this, it's like
picking crayons out of a crayon box.

55
00:02:45.520 --> 00:02:50.380
So this is our box of crayons here, and
just like if I was taking a crayon out of

56
00:02:50.380 --> 00:02:54.440
a box of crayons, I pull it out of
the box and I have it in my hand.

57
00:02:54.440 --> 00:02:58.040
And I'm ready to take this crayon and
then draw on the paper.

58
00:02:58.040 --> 00:03:01.030
And that's exactly what you're
going to be doing here.

59
00:03:01.030 --> 00:03:07.520
You're selecting the crayon to put in
your hand, and then draw on your paper.

60
00:03:07.520 --> 00:03:10.410
Cuz a lot of times, people say,
I really want this heart,

61
00:03:10.410 --> 00:03:13.230
you click it, and then they're like,
where's the heart?

62
00:03:13.230 --> 00:03:15.533
Now, you gotta draw it.

63
00:03:15.533 --> 00:03:16.499
There's two ways you can do this.

64
00:03:16.499 --> 00:03:21.050
You can single click once, and then it
just goes ahead and places the shape.

65
00:03:21.050 --> 00:03:22.680
Let's do that first one.

66
00:03:22.680 --> 00:03:23.840
Boom, there you go.

67
00:03:23.840 --> 00:03:25.330
There is my shape.

68
00:03:25.330 --> 00:03:28.770
It goes to its default aspect ratio and

69
00:03:28.770 --> 00:03:33.150
the default size that that particular
shape exists in within Word.

70
00:03:34.450 --> 00:03:36.120
Let's go back over here and
do another one.

71
00:03:36.120 --> 00:03:41.580
But the other way that we can add a shape
into our document is you click hold and

72
00:03:41.580 --> 00:03:42.520
drag.

73
00:03:42.520 --> 00:03:45.360
So that way you can make it
whatever size you want, and

74
00:03:45.360 --> 00:03:48.830
maybe you want the heart to be
a little longer or a little wider.

75
00:03:48.830 --> 00:03:50.460
You can control that as well.

76
00:03:50.460 --> 00:03:53.539
So if I click hold, and drag, and
I'm still holding that mouse button down.

77
00:03:53.539 --> 00:03:58.437
So I can go ahead and make it to whatever
kind of aspect ratio, we'll say,

78
00:03:58.437 --> 00:03:59.315
that I want.

79
00:03:59.315 --> 00:04:03.347
But now what if I wanted to make it
bigger but I wanna make sure that it

80
00:04:03.347 --> 00:04:07.525
stays proportionate to its dimensions
right when I'm dragging it,

81
00:04:07.525 --> 00:04:10.060
I still haven't let go of that mouse yet.

82
00:04:10.060 --> 00:04:11.494
Hold your Shift key.

83
00:04:11.494 --> 00:04:14.798
If you hold your Shift key down,
do you see how, I'll do it there,

84
00:04:14.798 --> 00:04:15.920
there hold the Shift.

85
00:04:15.920 --> 00:04:21.720
It constrains the proportions while you're
dragging to draw that particular shape.

86
00:04:21.720 --> 00:04:24.500
Now, if you do this, just

87
00:04:24.500 --> 00:04:29.710
conscientiously make sure you let go of
the mouse first, and then the Shift key.

88
00:04:29.710 --> 00:04:33.820
Because if you let go, sometimes if
you do it just a little bit before,

89
00:04:33.820 --> 00:04:37.220
well then it stops
maintaining that proportion.

90
00:04:37.220 --> 00:04:39.870
And then it just goes ahead and
makes it to wherever your mouse is.

91
00:04:39.870 --> 00:04:41.830
So just be aware of that.

92
00:04:41.830 --> 00:04:46.910
Do it slow at first then you can get a lot
faster, but mouse first then the Shift.

93
00:04:48.240 --> 00:04:53.200
So those are the two ways that you
can draw shapes into your document.

94
00:04:53.200 --> 00:04:58.370
Now, when we had inserted images
into Word, I always said,

95
00:04:58.370 --> 00:05:02.220
make sure your cursor is in the place
where you want the image to go and

96
00:05:02.220 --> 00:05:05.670
then what it does is it
puts it in line with text.

97
00:05:05.670 --> 00:05:08.770
It adds it like a character that
you're typing on in the keyboard,

98
00:05:08.770 --> 00:05:13.090
although shapes,
they're a little bit different.

99
00:05:13.090 --> 00:05:16.930
They're not in line with the text,
to begin with, and so

100
00:05:16.930 --> 00:05:21.600
you an move them anywhere you
want from the every start.

101
00:05:21.600 --> 00:05:23.555
You can't do that with pictures.

102
00:05:23.555 --> 00:05:26.861
What you have to do is you have
to change the word warp in it,

103
00:05:26.861 --> 00:05:28.960
then you can start moving it around.

104
00:05:28.960 --> 00:05:33.236
And it does make sure that it is anchored
to wherever the text is when you

105
00:05:33.236 --> 00:05:33.898
put it in.

106
00:05:33.898 --> 00:05:37.510
So let's jump over to the add graphics.

107
00:05:37.510 --> 00:05:39.520
And I'll put my cursor
in front of the d and

108
00:05:39.520 --> 00:05:43.080
down the rabbit hole because I want
to put the shape around there.

109
00:05:43.080 --> 00:05:45.680
Let's go back and insert that shape.

110
00:05:45.680 --> 00:05:49.900
And we will make our heart again,
click hold and drag, let go.

111
00:05:49.900 --> 00:05:56.490
And notice it's like floating on top
of the text and I can move it around.

112
00:05:56.490 --> 00:06:01.040
And the anchor over here on the left hand
side of where it's connecting itself to,

113
00:06:01.040 --> 00:06:03.420
because that's where I
have my cursor first,

114
00:06:03.420 --> 00:06:08.240
if I start moving it around,
it is moving with the text.

115
00:06:08.240 --> 00:06:12.810
And that is one of the defaults
that's on that particular word wrap.

116
00:06:12.810 --> 00:06:15.050
So let's come over to the Format tab.

117
00:06:15.050 --> 00:06:17.810
Because just like our images or
anything else that we put in our document

118
00:06:17.810 --> 00:06:20.920
that is not just regular text,
we get our contextual tab.

119
00:06:20.920 --> 00:06:21.510
That comes up.

120
00:06:22.820 --> 00:06:24.980
We have, over here, with our Wrap Text.

121
00:06:24.980 --> 00:06:28.260
And notice that the default one is,
In Front of Text.

122
00:06:29.520 --> 00:06:34.590
It's not, In Line with Text,
like the images do by default.

123
00:06:34.590 --> 00:06:37.200
So that's the one where it
can kind of float around.

124
00:06:37.200 --> 00:06:41.280
And it doesn't really
affect the text by default.

125
00:06:41.280 --> 00:06:43.230
It does move with text.

126
00:06:43.230 --> 00:06:43.830
That's on.

127
00:06:43.830 --> 00:06:48.030
It's not going to fix itself on
the page and not move around.

128
00:06:48.030 --> 00:06:52.460
This Move with Text is something that
we would probably like to have on.

129
00:06:52.460 --> 00:06:54.946
There's reasons why you don't and
don't want to.

130
00:06:54.946 --> 00:06:59.738
But what that means is if you start adding
text on top of wherever the paragraph that

131
00:06:59.738 --> 00:07:03.220
this is associated with,
that's what that anchor means.

132
00:07:03.220 --> 00:07:08.916
If I put text on top of it, in front of
it, it's gonna move all that other text

133
00:07:08.916 --> 00:07:14.190
down, and the image, or in this
sense the shape, will move with it.

134
00:07:14.190 --> 00:07:16.190
So that's what these two things mean.

135
00:07:16.190 --> 00:07:18.440
And you can turn them on and
turn them off.

136
00:07:18.440 --> 00:07:26.360
But if I don't want the shape on top of
the text or the text to move around it.

137
00:07:26.360 --> 00:07:29.340
So that's where you get
into your Square or

138
00:07:29.340 --> 00:07:34.300
your Tight type of,
what is this, Word Wrap.

139
00:07:34.300 --> 00:07:38.540
Or you can of course always have like
the Through or the Top and Bottom, so

140
00:07:38.540 --> 00:07:39.230
it only goes there.

141
00:07:39.230 --> 00:07:41.747
So you have different settings for
different reasons.

142
00:07:41.747 --> 00:07:46.053
We're gonna go with Tight here because
that way, if I move it over a little bit,

143
00:07:46.053 --> 00:07:49.801
you can see it's also kind of wrapping
around the shape of the heart.

144
00:07:49.801 --> 00:07:55.212
It's not square like the square of,
well The square.

145
00:07:55.212 --> 00:07:58.716
[LAUGH] It's not the square,
the square, the square, Ronnie.

146
00:07:58.716 --> 00:08:00.945
>> It's not the square of the heart
is what you meant to say.

147
00:08:00.945 --> 00:08:01.970
>> [LAUGH] Yes.
>> Which is weird.

148
00:08:01.970 --> 00:08:02.493
Yeah.
>> Right?

149
00:08:02.493 --> 00:08:03.108
[LAUGH]
>> It is.

150
00:08:03.108 --> 00:08:05.473
>> So
we have these different options here.

151
00:08:05.473 --> 00:08:09.849
And then the moving with the text, just to
demonstrate that concept because maybe you

152
00:08:09.849 --> 00:08:15.060
haven't watched the images episode, and so
you're like, this is all brand new to me.

153
00:08:15.060 --> 00:08:18.620
I'm going to copy all of this,
let's go put my cursor back here,

154
00:08:18.620 --> 00:08:21.630
hit enter, and
you can even start seeing it happen.

155
00:08:21.630 --> 00:08:27.000
See, the heart didn't stay fixed
in the position of the page.

156
00:08:27.000 --> 00:08:31.649
It's fixed in a position of where it's
anchored to that particular paragraph.

157
00:08:31.649 --> 00:08:35.084
So this paragraph moves,
the shape's gonna move too.

158
00:08:35.084 --> 00:08:37.432
Now, maybe you didn't want that,

159
00:08:37.432 --> 00:08:41.435
maybe I don't want the heart to
move in that location at all.

160
00:08:41.435 --> 00:08:46.197
You have to come back over to the wrap and
then choose to say,

161
00:08:46.197 --> 00:08:48.494
fixed position on the page.

162
00:08:48.494 --> 00:08:52.194
If I choose that, and
let's add some more text,

163

00:12:37.500 --> 00:12:41.730

We know that images are made up of pixels,

00:12:46.850 --> 00:12:50.500
And Photoshop will

231
00:12:50.500 --> 00:12:57.250
Vector images, when you have a vector
graphic, there are no pixels in that.

232
00:12:57.250 --> 00:13:01.718
It's a different concept for a lot of
people cuz, I think, they get pixels.

00:13:01.718 --> 00:13:04.864

00:13:04.864 --> 00:13:08.997
If you want to say with our phones and
our TVs, and things like that.

235
00:13:08.997 --> 00:13:10.765
But a.

236
00:13:10.765 --> 00:13:14.790
Yes, a vector graphic,
it's known as paths.

237
00:13:14.790 --> 00:13:19.730
And if you have paths you have fills and
strokes, insides and outsides.

238
00:13:19.730 --> 00:13:24.230
And these shapes are vector
graphics in a sense.

239
00:13:24.230 --> 00:13:30.060
So it's along that same Concept, and
when you have paths, you also have points.

240
00:13:30.060 --> 00:13:36.170
If you think about a square,
we'll throw in a square.

241
00:13:36.170 --> 00:13:38.600
Grab a square, click, hold, and drag.

242
00:13:38.600 --> 00:13:41.525
Square had four points on the corners and

243
00:13:41.525 --> 00:13:44.210
in-between you have paths that
connect them all together.

244
00:13:45.510 --> 00:13:46.220
Same with a circle,

245
00:13:46.220 --> 00:13:51.460
if I come over to my circle, this holding
the Shift key to keep it proportioned.

246
00:13:51.460 --> 00:13:56.420
That's four points, too,
but they're not straight.

247
00:13:56.420 --> 00:14:01.210
It's because points can also have curves
that come out of them, from those points,

248
00:14:01.210 --> 00:14:04.790
that the path travels a certain
way out of the point,

249
00:14:04.790 --> 00:14:07.990
comes into the point a certain way,
and you make that arch.

250
00:14:07.990 --> 00:14:13.060
And so that's the whole kind
of basis of virtual graphics.

00:14:13.060 --> 00:14:15.230
